message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public Date(String date) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(date, "/");
    int m = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
    int d = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
    int y = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
    if (y < 100) {
        y += 2000;
    }
    setComponents(m, d, y);
}

<<<explanation>>>: The error ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 2 occurs because the date string does not contain enough "/" delimiters to split into 3 parts. To fix this, you can use the StringTokenizer class to split the date string into tokens using the "/" delimiter. Then, you can parse each token into an integer and assign them to the variables m, d, and y. Make sure to check if the year is less than 100 and add 2000 to it if necessary. Finally, call the setComponents method with the parsed values.
